method.name: tlv_config
method.description: This procedure will create, modify or remove a TLV template or a TLV. Using the TLV Templates editor, you can define multiple templates to store user-defined TLVs. These TLVs may have a complex structure that exceeds the common Type, Length, Value fields, meaning that you can add additional fields and sub-TLVs.

description.text: The handle of a protocol stack or another handle returned by a prior tlv_config command.
The handle of a TLV from a default or custom TLV Template that will be used to define the structure of a new TLV that is added to the TLV Profile of a protocol.
The type of protocol that the TLV applies to.

choice.choiceText: TLV configuration for DHCPv4 Clients
TLV configuration for DHCPv4 Servers
TLV configuration for DHCPv6 Clients
TLV configuration for DHCPv6 Servers
TLV configuration for DHCPv4 Relay Agents
TLV configuration for DHCPv6 Relay Agents
TLV configuration for lightweight DHCPv6 Relay Agents
TLV configuration for Ancp
TLV configuration for ppp client
TLV configuration for BondedGRE client

restriction.value: dhcp4_client dhcp4_server dhcp6_client dhcp6_server dhcp4_relay dhcp6_relay dhcp6_relay_light ancp pppox_client bondedGRE

description.text: The action that the command will execute.

choice.choiceText: Create a new custom TLV Template group that will be used as a custom container for a series or TLVs.
Create a new TLV or sub TLV in a custom TLV Template or add a new TLV to the TLV Profile of a protocol.
Creates a new TLV container that can be used to add a group of nested sub TLVs to a custom TLV Template.
Creates a new field in a TLV from a TLV Template or the TLV Profile of a protocol.
Modifies an existing custom TLV Template, container, field, TLV or sub TLV.
Deletes an existing custom TLV Template, container, field, TLV or sub TLV.
Deletes all existing TLVs from the TLV Profile of specified protocol.

restriction.value: create_template_group create_tlv create_tlv_container create_field modify delete delete_all

description.text: When the -mode is create_template_group the value of this argument will be used to specify the name of the new TLV Template group. When the -mode is create_tlv the value of this argument will be used to find an existing TLV Template group with a matching name.
The name of the container.
The description of the container.
Flag indicating whether the container is required in the TLV definition from the TLV Template.
Flag indicating whether the container is editable in the TLV definition from the TLV Template.
Flag indicating whether the container is enabled or not in the TLV Profile of the protocol.
Indicates whether the new container can be multiplied in the TLV definition from the TLV Template.
The name of the TLV or subTLV.
The description of the TLV or subTLV.
Flag indicating whether the TLV or subTLV is enabled in the TLV profile of a protocol.
Indicates whether the current TLV or subTLV can be multiplied in the TLV definition from the TLV Template.
Indicates whether the current TLV or subTLV is required in the TLV definition from the TLV Template.
Indicates whether the current TLV or subTLV from a TLV Template is editable when added to the TLV Profile of a protocol.
Include the TLV in these protocol messages. Partial names of the messages can be used.
Clear all protocol messages that the TLV should be included in.
Enable this TLV or subTLV per session.
The name of the TLV field.
The description of the TLV field.
The encoding of the TLV field's value. Any change via this argument will result in the field's value being reset unless a matching value is specified for field_value.

choice.choiceText: The field encodes a Bool value
The field encodes a Decimal value
The field encodes a FC_ID value
The field encodes a Hex value
The field encodes a Float value
The field encodes an IPv4 value
The field encodes an IPv6 value
The field encodes a MAC value
The field encodes a String value
The field encodes a varLenHex value

restriction.value: bool decimal fcid hex float ipv4 ipv6 mac string varLenHex

description.text: The size of the TLV field's value. Any change via this argument will result in the field's value being reset unless a matching value is specified for field_value.
The value of the field. This can be a handle returned by multivalue_config.
Flag indicating whether the field is required in the TLV definition from the TLV Template.
Flag indicating whether the field is repeatable in the TLV definition from the TLV Template.
Enables/disables the field in the TLV Profile of a protocol.
Enables/disables editing for the field.
The name of the TLV type.
Enables/disables editing for the type.
Flag indicating whether the type is required in the TLV definition.
The name of the TLV length.
The description of the TLV length.
The encoding of the TLV length's value. Any change via this argument will result in the length's value being reset unless a matching value is specified for length_value.

choice.choiceText: The field encodes a Bool value
The field encodes a Decimal value
The field encodes a FC_ID value
The field encodes a Hex value
The field encodes a Float value
The field encodes an IPv4 value
The field encodes an IPv6 value
The field encodes a MAC value
The field encodes a String value
The field encodes a varLenHex value

restriction.value: bool decimal fcid hex float ipv4 ipv6 mac string varLenHex

description.text: The size of the TLV length's value. Any change via this argument will result in the length's value being reset unless a matching value is specified for length_value.
The value of the length. This can be a handle returned by multivalue_config.
Flag indicating whether the length is required in the TLV definition from the TLV Template.
Enables/disables editing for the length.
Enables/disables the length from the TLV Profile of a protocol.
This flag can be used to disable the name matching algorithm that attempts to look for a TLV template to copy when tlv_name and/or template_group_name are specified.

returnValue.value: A list containing the tlv template group protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the tlv template protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the tlv value protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the subtlv template protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the tlv field protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the tlv container protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the tlv type protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the tlv length protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the tlv protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the default tlv protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the subtlv protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).

notes.note: When -handle is provided with the /globals value the command will configure a TLV template.
